Package space.sunqian.fs.net.tcp

Class TcpClientBuilder

java.lang.Object
space.sunqian.fs.net.tcp.TcpClientBuilder
public class TcpClientBuilder extends Object
Builder for building new instances of TcpClient by SocketChannel.

  • Method Details

    • bufferSize

      @Nonnull public @Nonnull TcpClientBuilder bufferSize(int bufSize) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the buffer size for advanced IO operations. Note this buffer size is not the kernel network buffer size, it is an I/O advanced operations buffer size.
      Parameters:
      bufSize - the buffer size for advanced IO operations
      Returns:
      this builder
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the buffer size is negative or 0

    • socketOption

      @Nonnull public <T> @Nonnull TcpClientBuilder socketOption(@Nonnull @Nonnull SocketOption<T> name, T value) throws NetException
      Sets a socket option. This method can be invoked multiple times to set different socket options.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the socket option value
      Parameters:
      name - the socket option
      value - the value of the socket option, a value of null may be a valid value for some socket options.
      Returns:
      this builder
      Throws:
      NetException - If an error occurs
      See Also:
      • StandardSocketOptions

    • bind

      @Nonnull public @Nonnull TcpClientBuilder bind(@Nullable @Nullable InetSocketAddress localAddress)
      Binds the client's socket to the specified local address.
      Parameters:
      localAddress - the local address the client is bound to, may be null to bind to the automatically assigned address
      Returns:
      this builder
      Throws:
      NetException - If an error occurs

    • connect

      @Nonnull public @Nonnull TcpClient connect(@Nonnull @Nonnull InetSocketAddress remoteAddress) throws NetException
      Connects this client's socket to the specified remote address and configures the socket to listen for connections. And a new TcpClient instance is returned.
      Parameters:
      remoteAddress - the remote address the client connects to
      Returns:
      a new TcpClient with the configurations
      Throws:
      NetException - If an error occurs
